uk.blankaspect.common.json

Class JsonValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.blankaspect.common.json.JsonValue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    uk.blankaspect.common.tree.ITreeNode<JsonValue>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JsonArray, JsonBoolean, JsonNull, JsonNumber, JsonObject, JsonString

    public abstract class JsonValue
extends java.lang.Object
implements uk.blankaspect.common.tree.ITreeNode<JsonValue>
    This is the abstract base class of a JSON value. It implements ITreeNode to allow the methods of TreeUtils to be used on a tree of JSON values.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  JsonValue.Kind
      This is an enumeration of the kinds of JSON value.

      Creates a new instance of a JSON value with the specified parent.

      • getChildren

        public java.util.List<JsonValue> getChildren()

        Specified by:

      • isRoot

        public boolean isRoot()
        Returns true if this JSON value is the root of the tree to which it belongs. A JSON value is deemed to be the root if it has no parent.
        Returns:
        true if this JSON value is the root of the tree to which it belongs.

      • setParent

        public void setParent(JsonValue parent)
        Sets the parent of this JSON value to the specified JSON value.
        Parameters:
        parent - the JSON value to which the parent of this JSON value will be set, which should be null if this JSON value has no parent.

      • getPropertyName

        public java.lang.String getPropertyName()
        If this JSON value is the value of a property of a JSON object, returns the name of the property.
        Returns:
        if this JSON value is the value of a property of a JSON object, the name of the property; otherwise, null.

      • getElementIndex

        public int getElementIndex()
        If this JSON value is an element of a JSON array, returns the index of the element in the array's list of elements.
        Returns:
        if this JSON value is an element of a JSON array, the index of the element; otherwise, -1.

      • getPath

        public java.util.List<JsonValue> getPath()
        Returns the path of this JSON value from the root of the tree to which it belongs. The path is a list of n JSON values, where n > 0. The first n-1 elements of the list are the ancestors of this value, starting with the root and ending with the parent of this value; the last element is this value.
        Returns:
        a list that is the concatenation of
        • a sequence of the ancestors of this JSON value, starting with the root of the tree to which it belongs and ending with its parent, and
        • this value.
